metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11527 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ReadDPXImage function in coders/dpx.c in ImageMagick before 6.9.9-0 and7.x before 7.0.6-1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(memory consumption) via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11527` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8').
